metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the sol-def:patch_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the sol-def:patch_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity equal to some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity not equal to some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity greater than some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity greater than or equal to some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity less than some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity less than or equal to some value.

patch_test.comment: Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity equal to some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity not equal to some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity greater than some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity greater than or equal to some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity less than some value.
Test that the patch_object is supported with the base entity less than or equal to some value.

patch_object.comment: Retrieve a patch_item with a base equal to '118344'.
Retrieve patch_items with a base not equal to '118344'.
Retrieve patch_items with a base greater than '118343'.
Retrieve patch_items with a base greater than or equal to '118344'.
Retrieve patch_items with a base less than '118345'.
Retrieve patch_items with a base less than or equal to '118344'.

patch_state.comment: This state represents a patch_item with a base equal to '118344' and a version equal to '14'.
This state represents a patch_item with a base greater than or equal to '0' and a version greater than or equal to '0'.
